relation: Enters dial peer configuration mode and specifies the method of voice encapsulation.
Displays CDR events in the call history table.
Displays configuration information for dial peers.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS Voice Command Reference - A through C - ccs connect (controller) through clear vsp statistics [Support] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {39882=clear call fallback cache [ip-address] [ codec codec-type ], 1774=This command was implemented on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, Cisco 7200 series, and Cisco 7500 series.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {55832=The default line speed is 64 kbps when an E1 controller is configured on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 2600XM series, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, Cisco 3745, and the Cisco MC3810., 141607=This command was implemented on the Cisco 1750 and Cisco 1751 routers. Support for other Cisco platforms is not included in this release., 115261=codec codec-type, 216511=In the previous example, after clearing call counters for controller 1/3/0:8, TotalCalls and TotalDuration reset. In addition the DS0 HWM is also cleared to the number of active DS0s. Whenever the DS0 HWM is cleared, it does not reset to zero, but rather it is set to Active DS0s. For 1/3/0:8, the HWM is 1 after clearing because DS0 Active is 1 (1 active call). TotalDuration is 35 seconds for time slot 22, and TotalCall is 0 because they got reset when the clearcontrollercall-counters command was entered. Total calls on this time slot is incremented when a new call comes in on this time slot., 174745=This command was implemented on the voice/WAN interface cards (VWICs) for the Cisco 2600 series and Cisco 3600 series., 55005=The T1/E1 line is connected to the Motorola MPC-860x processor serial communication controller (SCC) or network module with two voice or WAN interface card (VIC or WIC) slots and 0/1/2 FastEthernet ports DSCC4 by default on Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 2600XM, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, and Cisco 3745 routers., 243704=This command was introduced on the Cisco 2600 series, the Cisco 3600 series, and on the Cisco MC3810., 124516=This command was introduced on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco MC3810., 118947=This command was modified in a release earlier than Cisco IOS Release 15.0(1)M. The codec keyword and codec-type argument were added., 18280=This command was implemented on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, Cisco 7200 series, and Cisco 7500 series., 55611=The default line speed is 56 kbps when a T1 controller is configured on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 2600XM series, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, Cisco 3745, and the Cisco MC3810., 185324=In the preceding example, only the system HWM is reset to active. For controllers 1/3/0:3 and 1/3/0:8, the HWMs are untouched., 59806=The aim keyword was added for use on the Cisco 2600 series (including the Cisco 2691), Cisco 2600XM, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, and Cisco 3745., 213636=After a call gets disconnected, only the DS0 Active field changes to reflect the current active call on the controller. In the above example, 1/3/0:8 DS0 Active is changed to 1., 41872=This command was introduced on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, Cisco AS5300, Cisco AS5350, and Cisco AS5400., 376552=Specifies the ID of the connection that needs to be closed in the SIP UDP process. The value argument represents the value of the connection ID. The range is from 1 to 2048., 292665=This command was implemented on the Cisco 3660, Cisco UBR924, and Cisco 2600 series., 115459=(Optional) Specifies the associated codec type., 54406=Specifies the use of all 32 time slots for data. None of the 32 time slots is used for framing signals on the Cisco ASR 901 Series, Cisco 2600XM series, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, and Cisco 3745. This keyword is applicable to E1 only., 84407=Creates an SS7-link-to-SS7-session-set association or to associate an SS7 link with an SS7 session set on the Cisco 2600-based SLT., 195328=This command was implemented on the voice and WAN interface cards (VWICs) for the Cisco 2600 series and Cisco 3600 series., 200224=The following is sample output that shows two controllers numbered 1/3/0:3 and 1/3/0:8. Note the differences in the output shown by the showcontrollerst1call-counters command and how the clearcontrollert1call-counters command affects the output:, 50406=Channel-group number on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 2600XM, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, and Cisco 3745 routers. When a T1 data line is configured, channel-group numbers can be values from 0 to 23. When an E1 data line is configured, channel-group numbers can be values from 0 to 30., 398017=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS XE Release 2.1 and implemented on the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services Routers., 42579=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(8)T and implemented on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco 7200 series. Support for the Cisco AS5300, Cisco AS5350, Cisco AS5400, and Cisco AS5800 is not included in this release., 58618=This command was modified to accommodate two channel groups on a port on 1- and 2-port T1/E1 multiflex voice or WAN interface cards on the Cisco 2600 and Cisco 3600 series routers., 90348=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(8)T and implemented on the Cisco IAD2420 series., 53582=(Optional) Directs HDLC traffic from the T1/E1 interface to the AIM-ATM-VOICE-30 digital signaling processor (DSP) card on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 2600XM series, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, and Cisco 3745., 354969=Specifies the ID of the connection that needs to be closed in the SIP TCP process. The connection-idargument represents the connection ID. The range is from 1 to 2048., 149504=This command was implemented on the Cisco 1750 and Cisco 1751 routers. Support for other Cisco platforms is not included in this release., 252388=Call signaling address and port (optional) of the endpoint. If a value for the port argument is not specified, the default is 1720., 207422=The following is sample output that shows controller 1/3/0:3, with time slots 22 and 23 connected and active. When theclearcontrollert11/3/0:3call-counterscommand is entered, the corresponding fields are set to zero., 60245=The unframed keyword was added for use on the Cisco 2600XM series, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, and Cisco 3745., 61526=Use this command to direct HDLC traffic from the T1/E1 interface to the AIM-ATM-VOICE-30 DSP card. A channel group is created using Advanced Integration Module (AIM) HDLC resources when a channel-group command with the aim keyword is parsed during system initialization or when the command is entered during configuration. You must specify the aim keyword under a T1/E1 controller port to direct HDLC traffic from the T1/E1 interface to the AIM-ATM-VOICE-30 DSP card on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 2600XM series, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, and Cisco 3745., 52928=The default line speed when configuring an E1 controller is 64 kbps on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 2600XM series, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, Cisco 3745, and Cisco MC3810., 89714=This command was implemented on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco MC3810., 62918=If previous channel-group commands are configured with the aim keyword, subsequent channel-group commands without the aim keyword are rejected. Similarly, if a regular channel-group command is followed by another channel-group command with the aim keyword implemented, the second command is rejected on the Cisco 2600 and Cisco 2600XM., 182181=In the example above, the system HWM is reset to the total number of active calls in the system, which is 3. The number was 4. When a call goes down, HWM values are untouched. Only the DS0 Active value changes. Above, there is only one call on 1/3/0:3. Observe the HWM for individual controllers. Total number of active calls is 1., 117231=This command was introduced on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco MC3810 series routers., 119528=If no IP address is specified, the clearcallfallbackcache command clears the cache of all CPIF estimates for all IP addresses. The available codec types are, g711alaw, g711ulaw, g723ar53, g723ar63, g723r53, g723r63, g726r16, g726r24, g726r32, g728, g729abr8, g729ar8, g729br8, g729r8, g729r8 pre-ietf, gsmamr-nb, gsmefr, gsmfr, and None., 52727=The default line speed when configuring a T1 controller is 56 kbps on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 2600XM series, Cisco 2691, Cisco 3631, Cisco 3660, Cisco 3725, Cisco 3745, and Cisco MC3810.}
textBeforeTable: Syntax Description no ccs connect { serial | atm } number [ [dlci] | pvc vpi/vci| pvcname ] [ cid-number ] ccs connect { serial | atm } number [ [dlci] | pvc vpi/vci| pvcname ] [ cid-number ] To configure a common channel signaling (CCS) connection on an interface configured to support CCS frame forwarding, use the ccsconnect command in controller configuration mode. To disable the CCS connection on the interface, use thenoform of this command. ccs connect (controller) clear vsp statistics clear voip fpi stats clear voip fpi rtts clear voice statistics clear voice phone-proxy all-sessions clear voice dsp clear voice accounting method clear tgrep neighbor clear tgrep counters clear subscription clear stcapp statistics clear statistics dial-peer voice clear ss7 sm-stats clear sip-ua udp connection clear sip-ua tcp tls connection clear sip-ua tcp connection clear sip-ua statistics clear sgcp statistics clear sdspfarm counters clear sccp server statistics clear rudpv1 statistics
textAfterTable: cid-number (Optional) If you have executed the ccsencapfrf11 command, the cid-number argument allows you to specify any channel identification (CID) number from 5 to 255. Command Default No CCS connection is made. Command Modes Controller configuration (config-controller) Command History Release Modification 12.0(2)T This command was introduced on the Cisco MC3810. 12.0(7)XK The cidnumber argument was added; the dlci keyword and vcdoptions were removed. 12.1(2)T The CID syntax addition and removal of the dlci keyword and vcd options were integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.1(2)T. 12.1(2)XH
